But they rebelled. Despite his love and mercy, Israel rebelled against her God (Deut. 32:15; Ps. 78:8; Neh. 9:16-18). Her people thus became enemies of God, as are all natural men and women (Mosiah 3:19).

vexed his holy Spirit. The Lord's people offended or grieved the Spirit (Eph. 4:30; D&C 121:37). When we make choices that turn us from the Spirit of God, that Spirit must leave us, and we, at the same time, become estranged from our Father and our God.

their enemy/he fought against them. The Lord punishes his people solely to motivate them to turn to him (Deut. 32:20-25; Judg. 2:14-15).
